summary: In this context, Heptane and n-heptane refer to the same chemical compound, with n-heptane being the systematic name for the straight-chain isomer of heptane. Both terms are used interchangeably to describe a volatile organic compound (VOC) found in gasoline and other fuels. The study highlights n-heptane as a dominant alkane in the vapor compositions of various fuels, indicating its significance in the analysis of VOCs in fuel emissions.
